nodes.description: 周六，一辆装满炸药的卡车在摩加迪沙的外围安全检查点外爆炸，造成300多人死亡，数百人受伤，这是索马里历史上最致命的袭击。
nodes.support_text: The truck, covered in dust, aroused the suspicions of soldiers who ordered the driver to park and get out. The driver, a man who soldiers said behaved in a friendly manner, made a phone call to someone in the capital. The driver passed the phone to the soldiers to speak to a well-known man who vouched for the truck and persuaded soldiers to allow it into the city, said the Somali intelligence official. Once through the checkpoint, the truck began to speed along the sandy, potholed road and raced through another checkpoint where soldiers opened fire and flattened one of its tires. A huge explosion from a truck bomb killed almost 200 people in Somalia's capital, police said Saturday, as shaken residents called it the most powerful blast ever witnessed in the city.

nodes.description: 政府官员详细描述了袭击的经过：一辆超载的卡车被伪装覆盖，驶近安全检查点，司机通过电话联系了一位知名人士，该人士担保卡车并说服士兵放行。
nodes.support_text: According to a Somali intelligence official investigating the blast, an overloaded truck covered with a tarpaulin approached a security checkpoint outside Mogadishu early Saturday. The truck, covered in dust, aroused the suspicions of soldiers who ordered the driver to park and get out. The driver, a man who soldiers said behaved in a friendly manner, made a phone call to someone in the capital. The driver passed the phone to the soldiers to speak to a well-known man who vouched for the truck and persuaded soldiers to allow it into the city, said the Somali intelligence official.

nodes.description: 卡车通过检查点后，加速穿过另一检查点，士兵开枪并损坏了其中一个轮胎，随后发生巨大爆炸。
nodes.support_text: Once through the checkpoint, the truck began to speed along the sandy, potholed road and raced through another checkpoint where soldiers opened fire and flattened one of its tires. A huge explosion from a truck bomb killed almost 200 people in Somalia's capital, police said Saturday, as shaken residents called it the most powerful blast ever witnessed in the city.

nodes.description: 周三，成千上万的人在摩加迪沙街头游行，表达对最致命袭击的反抗，并呼吁团结。
nodes.support_text: As thousands of people took to the streets of Somalia’s capital Wednesday in a show of defiance after the country’s deadliest attack, officials shared a detailed account of how Saturday’s truck bombing that killed more than 300 was carried out. They said two people have been arrested. Wearing red headbands, the crowd of mostly young men and women marched through Mogadishu amid tight security. They answered a call to unity by Mayor Thabit Abdi, who said 'we must liberate this city which is awash with graves.'

nodes.description: 索马里政府将袭击归咎于伊斯兰国极端组织，该组织通常针对摩加迪沙但未对此发表评论。
nodes.support_text: Somalia’s government has blamed Saturday’s attack on the al-Shabab extremist group, which often targets Mogadishu but has not commented.

nodes.description: 在抗议活动中，安全部队在试图驱散向袭击现场行进的抗议者时开枪，至少三人受伤，包括一名孕妇。
nodes.support_text: It was not all peaceful. At least three people, including a pregnant woman, were injured after security forces opened fire while trying to disperse protesters marching toward the attack site, said police Capt. Mohammed Hussein. Both Somali police and African Union soldiers were at the scene and opened fire, he said.

nodes.description: 索马里的一些人询问为什么近年来最致命的袭击之一没有像其他地方极端主义袭击那样引起全球关注
nodes.support_text: 索马里的一些人询问为什么近年来最致命的袭击之一没有像其他地方极端主义袭击那样引起全球关注

nodes.description: 索马里的一些人将这次轰炸称为他们的9/11
nodes.support_text: 索马里的一些人将这次轰炸称为他们的9/11

nodes.description: 根据语义描述，事件涉及杀害行为，但当前图中未体现。
分析师们建议基地组织可能避免了承担责任

nodes.description: 它不希望被指责为许多平民的死亡负责
nodes.support_text: 它不希望被指责为许多平民的死亡负责
A huge explosion from a truck bomb killed almost 200 people in Somalia's capital, police said Saturday, as shaken residents called it the most powerful blast ever witnessed in the city.

edges.support_text: According to a Somali intelligence official investigating the blast, an overloaded truck covered with a tarpaulin approached a security checkpoint outside Mogadishu early Saturday. The truck, covered in dust, aroused the suspicions of soldiers who ordered the driver to park and get out. The driver, a man who soldiers said behaved in a friendly manner, made a phone call to someone in the capital. The driver passed the phone to the soldiers to speak to a well-known man who vouched for the truck and persuaded soldiers to allow it into the city, said the Somali intelligence official.

Once through the checkpoint, the truck began to speed along the sandy, potholed road and raced through another checkpoint where soldiers opened fire and flattened one of its tires. A huge explosion from a truck bomb killed almost 200 people in Somalia's capital, police said Saturday, as shaken residents called it the most powerful blast ever witnessed in the city.

As thousands of people took to the streets of Somalia’s capital Wednesday in a show of defiance after the country’s deadliest attack, officials shared a detailed account of how Saturday’s truck bombing that killed more than 300 was carried out. They said two people have been arrested. Wearing red headbands, the crowd of mostly young men and women marched through Mogadishu amid tight security. They answered a call to unity by Mayor Thabit Abdi, who said 'we must liberate this city which is awash with graves.'
Somalia’s government has blamed Saturday’s attack on the al-Shabab extremist group, which often targets Mogadishu but has not commented.

It was not all peaceful. At least three people, including a pregnant woman, were injured after security forces opened fire while trying to disperse protesters marching toward the attack site, said police Capt. Mohammed Hussein. Both Somali police and African Union soldiers were at the scene and opened fire, he said.
